snippet: With the nuclear deal now poised to go into effect, the meeting represents the first major effort by President Obama to reassure crucial Persian Gulf allies.
abstract: Obama administration officials announce Pentagon is finalizing agreement that will provide $1 billion in weapons to Saudi Arabia to aid it in fight against Islamic State; deal comes as administration is reassuring Arab allies that United States will support them in face of rising Iran.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and GARDINER HARRIS

lead_paragraph: With the nuclear deal now poised to go into effect, the meeting represents the first major effort by President Obama to reassure crucial Persian Gulf allies.

headline.main: An Arms Deal Is Aimed at Saudis’ Iran Worries
headline.print_headline: An Arms Deal Is Aimed at Saudis’ Iran Worries

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
